head.title: Food Drives: Where to Share During the Holiday Season

identified-content.classifier: Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Government, Philanthropy and NGO

hedline.hl1: Food Drives: Where to Share During the Holiday Season

block.p: As the holidays approach, some food programs for the needy are beginning their annual food drives while others are continuing their year-round efforts. Here is a list of programs that accept donations: ALL BOROUGHS

CITY HARVEST AND THE FIRE DEPARTMENT More than 200 firehouses in the five boroughs are designated to receive packaged and canned foods. No glass except for baby food. No perishables. No turkeys. Through New Year. For location of nearest firehouse: (212) 463-0456.

As the holidays approach, some food programs for the needy are beginning their annual food drives while others are continuing their year-round efforts. Here is a list of programs that accept donations: ALL BOROUGHS

CITY HARVEST AND THE FIRE DEPARTMENT More than 200 firehouses in the five boroughs are designated to receive packaged and canned foods. No glass except for baby food. No perishables. No turkeys. Through New Year. For location of nearest firehouse: (212) 463-0456.

SALVATION ARMY Donations go to needy families and individuals. Turkeys, frozen or fresh, and canned goods are accepted. No glass or perishables. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 8:30 A.M. to 5 P.M. Manhattan: 120 West 14th Street, (212) 337-7343; Harlem Temple, 540 Lenox Avenue, (212) 862-3900. Brooklyn: Brooklyn Citadel, 321 Ashland Place, Fort Greene, (718) 638-2844; 601 Lafayette Avenue, Bedford-Stuyvesant, (718) 622-0614. Bronx: Bronx Citadel, 425 East 159th Street, South Bronx (718) 665-8472. Queens: Jamaica Citadel, 90-23 161st Street, Jamaica,(718) 297-4860. Staten Island: 1295 Forest Avenue, Port Richmond, (718) 442-2145.

FEDERATION OF PROTESTANT WELFARE AGENCIES Contributes to churches with feeding programs citywide. Neighborhood referral information: 281 Park Avenue South, Manhattan, (212) 777-4800, extension 331. MANHATTAN
BAILEY HOUSE All foods accepted. Serves homeless people with AIDS. Open 24 hours daily. 180 Christopher Street, Greenwich Village, (212) 337-3000.

BETHEL LIGHT COMMUNITY CHURCH A soup kitchen, pantry and shelter for men and women. All foods but pork accepted. Mondays through Saturdays, 9 A.M. to 6 P.M. 36-38 West 123d Street, Harlem, (212) 427-2839.
EMMAUS HOUSE A soup kitchen and pantry accepting donations of all foods, perishable or not. Open 24 hours daily. 2027 Lexington Avenue, at 124th Street, Harlem, (212) 410-6006.

PETER'S PLACE A 24-hour drop-in service for homeless people operated by the Partnership for the Homeless. All foods accepted. Church of St. Vincent De Paul, 123 West 23d Street, Chelsea, (212) 727-0725.

PELHAM FRITZ APARTMENTS Transitional housing for homeless families, operated by the Children's Aid Society. All foods accepted. Monday to Saturday, 9 A.M. to 8 P.M. 17-21 West 118th Street, Harlem, (212) 348-5356. BROOKLYN

EARTH GENERAL All fresh, packaged and canned foods are accepted. Food will be distributed by Christian Help in Park Slope, a soup kitchen. Today, noon to 6 P.M. 72 Seventh Avenue, between Lincoln and Berkeley Streets, Park Slope.
CATHOLIC CHARITIES Accepts nonperishables for distribution to soup kitchens. Monday to Friday, 9 A.M. to 5 P.M. through New Year. 191 Joralemon, Brooklyn Heights, (718) 596-5500.

BREAD AND LIFE Accepts donations of nonperishables year round. Soup kitchen serving homeless people and low-income families. Monday to Friday Before 11 A.M. 75 Lewis Avenue, Bedford-Stuyvesant, (718) 455-6864.

BOND STREET DROP-IN CENTER Accepts fresh food and nonperishables year round. Serving homeless people. Operated by Catholic Charities. Daily 10 A.M. to 2 P.M. 39-41 Bond Street, Downtown Brooklyn, (718) 935-0439. QUEENS

QUEENS EAST FAMILY CENTER and QUEENS WEST FAMILY CENTER Operated by the Catholic Charities. Canned and packaged nonperishables are accepted. Mondays through Fridays, 9 A.M. to 5 P.M. Closed Thanksgiving Day through next Sunday. East: 90-39 189th Street, Hollis, (718) 217-1440. West: 70-11 48th Avenue, Woodside, (718) 899-8493. BRONX
PART OF THE SOLUTION Soup kitchen accepting canned goods and nonperishables. Daily, 9 A.M. to 5 P.M. 2763 Webster Avenue, at 197th Street, Fordham. (718) 220-4892. PUBLIC INTEREST
